choices.D: Inform the Sales Account Manager to position a new version of licenses types B and D with additional features
choices.C: Provide trending information on license types B and D and share with all stakeholders
choices.B: Share the report with the customer point of contact for license types B and D and determine causes
choices.A: Run analysis on all the license types used by the customer on all platforms

discussion.content:
The answer correct is :
B. Share the report with the customer point of contact for license types B and D and determine causes

Selected Answer: B
B. Share the report with the customer point of contact for license types B and D and determine causes.

License types B and D show a decrease in the number of features in use from March to May. Sharing the report with the customer point of contact and discussing the reasons behind this decrease can help identify any issues or challenges that might be affecting the utilization of these licenses. This proactive approach allows the Customer Success Manager to address potential adoption barriers and work collaboratively with the customer to ensure they are getting the most value from the licenses.

Selected Answer: B
Same opinion

Selected Answer: B
CSM should investigate and try to resolve the issue with the customer. Then revalidate it later.

comments.content: I think C is correct. The blackbelt training does not use "point of contact" at the customer's side at all. They speak about stakeholders.

discussion.content: I think is B

discussion.content: Answer should be: Which method is directly associated with evaluating a customer outcome?

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. Which initial action does a Customer Success Manager take?
//IMG//

choices.C: Utilize the service team to form a larger internal team to lead the engagement
choices.B: Utilize people to focus on the elite customers for a 1:1 or 1:few onsite customer success experience
choices.A: Utilize a digital engagement so all your customers experience the touch of customer success
choices.D: Utilize people to focus your customers in a 1:many customer success experience

discussion.content: High touch is 1:1. B is correct.
correct answer is B
The answer correct is B. Utilize people to focus on the elite customers for a 1:1 or 1:few onsite customer success experience

Selected Answer: B
A high-touch customer success experience typically involves dedicated Customer Success Managers or teams working closely with a smaller group of elite customers. This allows for personalized attention and tailored solutions to meet the unique needs of each customer. Onsite engagements and personalized interactions can build strong relationships and drive successful outcomes.

Selected Answer: B
In a high-touch customer success experience, the focus is on building strong, personalized relationships with customers, understanding their unique needs, and providing tailored support to help them achieve their desired outcomes.

Selected Answer: B
Foundations of Customer Success - eBook: Typically, a CSM to customer ratio is less than 1:20, focused on high-value, named accounts

Selected Answer: A
Foundations of Customer Success - eBook: Typically, a CSM to customer ratio is less than 1:20, focused on high-value, named accounts.

Selected Answer: B
Should be B
As per Cisco documentation, it's B the correct answer.
I think it is B and not A.
I agree, correct answer is B

questions.question_text: A Customer Success Manager must deliver high touch customer success experience. Which customer engagement model must be used?

DRAG DROP -
The Customer Success Manager is preparing for a review meeting. The customer has asked for a balance between subjective and objective metrics. Drag and drop the inputs from the left onto the correct subjective and objective categories on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

comments.content: Can we really track the percentage of marketing emails opened? I don't think so.
Yes we can, mailchimp for example do :)

discussion.content: "number of customer escalations and number of customers retained" are objective. and "percentage of marketing emails are opened" should be objective too.

1- Customers Perceived Values: Subjective

2- Customer Satisfaction Rating: Subjective

3- Number of Customer Escalations: Objective

4- Number of Customers Retained: Objective

5- Percentage of Marketing Emails that are Opened and Responded to: Objective

6- Value Feedback: Assuming that "value feedback" refers to feedback on the value provided by the product or service, this metric would be subjective.

B. health score
D. telemetry

Selected Answer: BD
I would go for a health score and telemetry. Helpdesk data are not mentioned in the blackbelt training at all. Btw, the "health index" would be more precise than "health score", hopefully, it is not a catch.

comments.content: Telemetry collects metrics, but is not a metric

discussion.content: My vote is for B & D. Because how can we know usage without telemetry?..

he responsible, accountable, consulted, informed (RACI) model can be used as an effective tool to manage the allocation of roles in a group/cross functional project to ensure efficient execution.
